column1: The '''Pass of Sirion''', in the [[First Age]], was a steep-sided pass between the [[Ered Wethrin]] and the [[Echoriad]], on the upper reaches of the River [[Sirion]].<ref>{{S
column2: Map}}</ref>  The sheer walls were covered with pines yet the vale was green.  In the middle of the pass was the isle of [[Tol Sirion]] where [[Finrod]] built the tower of [[Minas Tirith (Beleriand)
column3: Minas Tirith]].  After Finrod departed to [[Nargothrond]] the fortress was committed to Finrod's kinsman [[Orodreth]].<ref>{{S

column1: During the [[Dagor Bragollach]] King [[Finrod]] was surrounded with a small company in the [[Fen of Serech]].  There he would have fallen but for the arrival of [[Barahir]] who came through the Pass of Sirion and rescued him.<ref>{{S
column2: Fingolfin}}</ref>  However, by the end of this great battle [[Morgoth]] held the Pass.
